thing-type.label: HKZW-SO05 Smart Plug
thing-type.description: Smart Plug<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSmart plug is a Z-Wave Switch plugin module specifically used to enable Z-Wave command and control (on/off) of any plug-in tool. It can report wattage consumption or kWh energy usage. Smart Plug is also a security Z-Wave device and supports the Over The Air (OTA) feature for the product's firmware upgrade.</p&gt <p&gtHKZW-SO05 is a Smart Plug based on Z-Wave plus specification</p&gt <p&gtThe features list:</p&gt <p&gt1) Supports 1xAC output and 2xUSB outputs;</p&gt <p&gt2) AC output switch on/off by manual or Z-Wave command;</p&gt <p&gt3) RGB LED indicates the Z-Wave network range;</p&gt <p&gt4) RGB LED indicates the load power;</p&gt <p&gt5) Z-Wave plus compatible (500 serials product);</p&gt <p&gt6) supporting power meter;</p&gt <p&gt7) supporting repeater role;</p&gt <p&gtSupporting firmware OTA;</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<strong&gtAutomatic Z-Wave network inclusion:</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gt1) Set the Z-Wave network main controller into inclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gt2) Insert the Plug into a socket.</p&gt <p&gt3) Auto-inclusion will be activated, i.e. Plug automatically starts looking for Z-Wave network controller. Auto-inclusion activation is signaled by a single, RGB LED indicator blink fast in blue.</p&gt <p&gt4) Smart Plug should be recognized and automatically included into the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtManual Z-Wave network inclusion:</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gt1) Connect the power supply.</p&gt <p&gt2) Set the Z-Wave network main controller into inclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gt3) Triple click the Z-button, RGB LED indicator should blink fast in blue.</p&gt <p&gt4) Smart Plug should be recognized and included into the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtIncluded as a secure device:</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gt1) Connect the power supply.</p&gt <p&gt2) Set the Z-Wave network main controller into secure inclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gt3) Press and hold the Z-button for more than 3 seconds, RGB LED indicator should blink fast in green.</p&gt <p&gt4) Smart Plug should be recognized and included into the Z-Wave security network.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<strong&gtTo remove Smart Plug from the Z-Wave network:</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gt1) Insert the plug into a socket.</p&gt <p&gt2) Set the Z-Wave network main controller into exclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gt3) Triple click the Z-button.</p&gt <p&gt4) RGB LED indicator will blink orange till the removing process is completed, then the indicator will keep orange for 3 seconds.</p&gt
